subject: Ethics
title: Metadata Reveals More Than Content
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Metadata Reveals More Than Content.

hook.text: The NSA once said, 'We kill people based on metadata.' Not jokes, not content â€” just metadata.

buildup.text: Metadata is data about data: who you called, when, for how long, and from where. Not what you said.

discovery.text: A Stanford study proved phone metadata alone can reveal medical conditions, gun ownership, and affairs.

twist.text: Governments argue metadata isn't private because it's 'just' logistics. But logistics map your entire life.

climax.text: Knowing someone called a suicide hotline at 2 AM for 40 minutes tells you everything without a word.

punchline.text: They don't need your words when the pattern says it all.

quiz.question: What did a Stanford study show about phone metadata?
options: It's too encrypted to be useful
It can reveal health conditions and personal details
It only shows call duration and nothing else
